summary: This document is an email chain from July 22, 2008, between an FBI agent and an Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) in West Palm Beach. The emails discuss logistical details for sending letters, including locating an address for an individual referred to as 'MI'. The tone is informal and expresses significant stress, with the FBI agent mentioning physical pain and attributing it to the Epstein case.

persons.name: C. (USAFLS)
persons.context: The recipient of the emails, based in West Palm Beach, FL. They are coordinating with an FBI agent on case logistics, specifically regarding addresses for letters.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Referenced by the FBI agent as the potential cause of stress and physical pain ('an ulcer from Epstein'), indicating the case is a source of significant pressure.

connections.description: Working together on the logistics of the Epstein investigation, specifically coordinating the delivery of letters and leads.
The FBI agent is investigating Epstein and explicitly cites the case as a source of personal stress and physical discomfort.

events.title: Email coordination on case logistics
events.description: FBI agent and AUSA exchange emails to coordinate obtaining a letter and an address for 'MI' to be included with an investigative lead.

keyFacts: The document reveals high stress levels among investigators, with an FBI agent mentioning physical pain ('pain in my gut') and wondering if it's 'an ulcer from Epstein'.
Investigators are actively trying to locate individuals connected to the case, as evidenced by the legat finding an address for 'MI' in Virginia.
The communication is informal and urgent, with phrases like 'THIS IS cRAzy' and 'take a deep breath' highlighting the tense atmosphere.
The correspondence focuses on the logistical step of preparing and hand-delivering letters as part of the investigative process.
